data.title: Royal Academy of Arts
data.meta_description: The Royal Academy of Arts, located in the heart of London, is a place where art is made, exhibited and debated.
data.text:
Rudyard Kipling (1865 - 1936)

RA Collection: People and Organisations

English journalist, short-story writer, poet, and novelist. His works of fiction include The Jungle Book (1894), Kim (1901), and many short stories, including “The Man Who Would Be King” (1888). His poems include “Mandalay” (1890), “Gunga Din” (1890), “The Gods of the Copybook Headings” (1919), “The White Man’s Burden” (1899), and “If—” (1910).
